poem.content:
The north wind whispers, a patient sigh,
Across the plains, where shadows slide.
A junior raven, bold, yet shy,
Dreams of skies where eagles ride.

He longs to promote songs of genuine flight,
To kick away the doubt that binds,
To paint the canvas of the fading light,
With memories etched on sun-kissed minds.

The apple of his eye, a distant gleam,
A culture of peace, heâ€™s heard it said.
But doubt, a venomous, waking dream,
Threatens the path already tread.

They deny him entry, the elders do,
Their tone, a hammer, cold and stark.
Each point against him, piercing through,
Leaving its mark. A severed limb in the dark.

Yet, in his heart, a fire burns,
He'll reach that peace, his spirit yearns.
